HOUSE BILL No. 1580
_____
DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
Citations Affected:  IC 21-44-8; IC 34-30-2.1-293.5.
Synopsis:  Parkinson's disease registry. Requires the Indiana
University School of Medicine to collect data on the incidence of
Parkinson's disease and establish a Parkinson's disease registry.
Requires health care providers to report a diagnosis of Parkinson's
disease and a related condition to the registry, and, if a patient agrees
to the reporting, additional information concerning the medical
treatment. Requires the health care provider to provide certain
information to a patient diagnosed with Parkinson's disease or a related
condition and to receive either permission or a denial to provide other
information concerning the diagnosis and treatment. Requires that the
information be confidential. Provides immunity to a person that
provides information for the registry. Specifies persons that can obtain
information from the registry. 
Effective:  July 1, 2025.
Hamilton,  Errington
January 21, 2025, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Public Health.

1 SECTION 1. IC 21-44-8 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE AS
2 A NEW CHAPTER TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE JULY

4 Chapter 8. Parkinson's Disease Registry
5 Sec. 1. As used in this chapter, "Parkinson's disease" means a
6 chronic and progressive neurologic disorder resulting from
7 deficiency of the neurotransmitter dopamine as the consequence of
8 specific degenerative changes in the basal ganglia, characterized by
9 the following:
10 (1) Tremor at rest.
11 (2) Slow movements.
12 (3) Muscle rigidity.
13 (4) Stooped posture.
14 (5) Unsteady or shuffling gait.
15 Sec. 2. As used in this chapter, "registry" refers to the
16 Parkinson's disease registry established under section 3 of this
17 chapter.

1 Sec. 3. (a) The Indiana University School of Medicine or an
2 entity under an agreement described in subsection (h) shall collect
3 data on the incidence of Parkinson's disease in Indiana and
4 establish a Parkinson's disease registry.
5 (b) The dean of the Indiana University School of Medicine shall
6 oversee the registry and the collection of data under this chapter.
7 (c) The Indiana University School of Medicine shall establish an
8 advisory committee to do the following:
9 (1) Assist in the development and implementation of the
10 registry.
11 (2) Determine the data to be collected for the registry,
12 including the related conditions to be reported.
13 (3) Advise the Indiana University School of Medicine
14 concerning the data collection and registry.
15 (d) The advisory committee must include at least one (1) of each
16 of the following:
17 (1) A general neurologist.
18 (2) A movement disorder specialist.
19 (3) A primary care physician.
20 (4) A physician who practices clinical informatics.
21 (5) A patient diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.
22 (6) A public health staff member.
23 (7) A population health researcher familiar with health
24 related registries.
25 (8) A Parkinson's disease researcher.
26 (9) A clinical data management expert representative from
27 the Regenstrief Institute.
28 (10) Any other individual determined by the Indiana
29 University School of Medicine to be able to assist with the
30 establishment and implementation of the collection of data
31 and the registry under this chapter.
32 (e) The Indiana University School of Medicine shall establish a
33 system for the collection and dissemination of information
34 determining the incidence and prevalence of Parkinson's disease
35 and related conditions.
36 (f) The Indiana University School of Medicine may create,
37 review, and revise a list of data points required to be reported to
38 the registry under this chapter. The information to be reported
39 must at least include the following:
40 (1) Triggering diagnostic conditions, consistent with the most
41 recent International Statistical Classification of Diseases and
42 Related Health Problems (ICD).

19 Sec. 4. (a) A health care provider (as defined in IC 16-36-7-12)
20 who diagnoses a patient with Parkinson's disease or a related
21 condition shall do the following:
22 (1) Notify a patient verbally and in writing about the registry
23 and answer any questions the patient may have about the
24 registry.
25 (2) Ask the patient whether the patient would like to
26 participate in the registry and provide medical information
27 concerning the patient's Parkinson's disease diagnosis and
28 treatment to the registry.
29 (3) If the patient declines to participate in the data collection
30 and registry:
31 (A) certify in writing that the notification required under
32 subdivision (1) was provided, the patient was offered the
33 opportunity to ask any questions, and that the patient
34 declined to participate in the registry; and
35 (B) report to the registry only that the health care provider
36 diagnosed an individual with Parkinson's disease or a
37 related condition.
38 (4) If the patient agrees to participate in the data collection
39 and registry, provide the information to the registry in the
40 manner prescribed by the Indiana University School of
41 Medicine.
42 (b) Each patient diagnosed with Parkinson's disease or a related

1 condition shall be notified about the registry and provided the
2 opportunity to participate in providing data and inclusion in the

10 Sec. 5. A person that reports information to the registry under
11 this chapter is immune from any civil or criminal liability that
12 might otherwise be imposed because of the release of what is
13 otherwise confidential information.
14 Sec. 6. Notwithstanding any other law and except as otherwise
15 provided in this chapter, the confidential information collected
16 under this chapter may not be disclosed, is not discover able, and
17 may not be compelled to be produced in any civil, criminal,
18 administrative, or other proceeding. The confidential information
19 is not admissible as evidence in any civil, criminal, administrative,
20 or other tribunal or court for any reason. This section does not
21 preclude an individual to whom the information pertains to access
22 the individual's own information.
23 Sec. 7. This chapter does not preclude a health care provider
24 from providing diagnostic or treatment services to patients with
25 Parkinson's disease to maintain the health care provider's own
26 facility based Parkinson's disease data base or registry.
